body.p:
Santa Fe N M February 22d 1863.
To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.
Sir.

From a letter just received from my friend Col C J. Walker 10th Ky Cavalry, I make the following extract. viz. "When I was in Frankfort, several weeks ago, the Governor told me that he would make you Inspector Genl of the state if you would accept it" With many tanks to your Excellency for your kindess I will accept the position with pleasure if offered to me. It is, however, due to you to say, that since the issue of the Presidents Emancipation proclimation, I cannot retain my present position, and thus, give countenance to what I in conscience condemn. I endorse every word of your Excellencies message to the Legislatrue on that subject
Please address me at this place

Very Respectfully
your obt svt
John C. McFerran
Captain & A Q M

Santa Fe.
Feby 22nd/63.
McFerran Jno C.
Capt and A. Q. M.
To Gov. Will accept position of Inspector Gen. Ky. if offered him.
